body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->
<button class="accordion-button" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseOne" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseOne">
<div id="collapseOne" class="accordion-collapse collapse show" aria-labelledby="headingOne" data-bs-parent="#accordionExample">

This is the first item's accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">

This is the second item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseThree">

This is the third item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
<!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Adds .accordion-flush to remove the default background-color, some borders, and some rounded corners to render accordions edge-to-edge with their parent container. -->
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#flush-collapseOne" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="flush-collapseOne">
Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the first item's accordion body.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#flush-collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="flush-collapseTwo">

Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the second item's accordion body. Let's imagine this being filled with some actual content.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#flush-collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="flush-collapseThree">

Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the third item's accordion body. Nothing more exciting happening here in terms of content, but just filling up the space to make it look, at least at first glance, a bit more representative of how this would look in a real-world application.
Accordion flush.description: Accordion without the default background-color, some borders, and some rounded corners to render accordions edge-to-edge with their parent container.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Accordion that omits the data-bs-parent attribute on each .accordion-collapse to make accordion items stay open when another item is opened. -->

This is the first item's accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.

This is the second item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.

This is the third item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
Accordion always open.description: Accordion that omits the data-bs-parent attribute on each .accordion-collapse to make accordion items stay open when another item is opened.

body: <!-- DESCRIPTION: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages. -->
A simple primary alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple secondary alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple success alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple danger alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple warning alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple info alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple light alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
A simple dark alert with an example link. Give it a click if you like.
Alert.description: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

body: <!-- DESCRIPTION: Alerts can also contain additional HTML elements like headings, paragraphs and dividers. -->
Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.
Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.
Alert with additional content.description: Alerts can also contain additional HTML elements like headings, paragraphs and dividers.

body: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="24" height="24" fill="currentColor" class="bi bi-exclamation-triangle-fill flex-shrink-0 me-2" viewBox="0 0 16 16" role="img" aria-label="Warning:">
An example alert with an icon
<!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->

<div class="alert alert-warning alert-dismissible fade show" role="alert">
Holy guacamole! You should check in on some of those fields below.

Breadcrumb divider.description: Add text or SVG divider to a breadcrumb.

<ul class="pagination"> <!-- Add justify-content-center or justify-content-end to change alignment -->
Pagination.description: Pagination to indicate a series of related content exists across multiple pages.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.bundle.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Add popovers, like those found in iOS, to any element on your site. -->
<!-- To change position: modify data-bs-placement="right" with "top" "bottom" or "left" -->

<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-container="body" data-bs-toggle="popover" data-bs-placement="right" title="Popover title" data-bs-content="Here goes popover content.">Popover</button>
Popover.description: Add popovers, like those found in iOS, to any element on your site.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.bundle.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Dismiss popovers on the user’s next click of a different element. -->
Dismissible popover
<!-- Use the focus trigger to dismiss popovers on the user’s next click of a different element than the toggle element. -->
Popover dismissible.description: Dismiss popovers on the user’s next click of a different element.

body: <!-- DESCRIPTION: Custom progress bars featuring support for stacked bars, animated backgrounds, and text labels. -->
<div class="progress"> <!-- Add CSS height attribute to this div to modify full progress bar's height -->
<div class="progress"> <!-- Add CSS height attribute to this div to modify full progress bar's height -->
25%
Progress bar.description: Custom progress bars featuring support for stacked bars, animated backgrounds, and text labels.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->
<!-- NOTE: Must be used on a Bootstrap nav component or list group. Requires position: relative; on the element you’re spying on. -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Automatically update navigation or list group components based on scroll position to indicate which link is currently active in the viewport. -->
<nav id="navbar-example2" class="navbar navbar-light bg-light px-3 fixed-top">
<div data-bs-spy="scroll" data-bs-target="#navbar-example2" data-bs-offset="0" class="scrollspy-example position-relative" tabindex="0" style="height: 250px; overflow-y: scroll; margin-top: 70px;">

Scrollspy.description: Automatically update navigation components based on scroll position to indicate which link is currently active in the viewport.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.min.js to work -->
<!-- NOTE: Must be used on a Bootstrap nav component or list group. Requires position: relative; on the element you’re spying on. -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Automatically update list group components based on scroll position to indicate which link is currently active in the viewport. -->
<div data-bs-spy="scroll" data-bs-target="#list-example" data-bs-offset="0" class="scrollspy-example position-relative" tabindex="0" style="height: 250px; overflow-y: scroll">

This is some placeholder content for the scrollspy page. Note that as you scroll down the page, the appropriate navigation link is highlighted. It's repeated throughout the component example. We keep adding some more example copy here to emphasize the scrolling and highlighting.

body: <!-- DESCRIPTION: Indicate the loading state of a component or page. -->
Spinner.description: Indicate the loading state of a component or page.

body: <!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.bundle.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Push notifications to your visitors. -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" id="liveToastBtn">Show live toast</button>
<div id="liveToast" class="toast hide text-white bg-primary" role="alert" aria-live="assertive" aria-atomic="true">
Hello, world! This is a toast message.
<!-- NOTE: This component requires bootstrap.bundle.min.js to work -->
<!-- DESCRIPTION: Tooltips with CSS and JavaScript -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-toggle="tooltip" data-bs-placement="top" title="Tooltip on top">
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-toggle="tooltip" data-bs-placement="right" title="Tooltip on right">
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-toggle="tooltip" data-bs-placement="bottom" title="Tooltip on bottom">
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-toggle="tooltip" data-bs-placement="left" title="Tooltip on left">
